content: 1 a little alien hat knitting pattern by samantha west the inspiration for this hat was drawn from the allies of humanity books by marshall vian summers materials one 3 25mm us size 3 circular needle 40cm 16 in length or size needed to meet the required gauge one 2 75mm us size 2 circular needle 40cm 16 in length or a 40cm circular needle one us size smaller than needle size used to obtain gauge one 3 25mm us size 3 circular needle 80cm 32 or 100cm 40 in length for magic loop or one set of 3 25mm us size 3 dpns or size needed to meet the required gauge stitch markers optional one of which is used to mark the beginning of round tapestry needle for sewing in threads blocking materials fingering weight yarn in two colours approximately 200m 218yrds of the main colour dark and approximately 50m 55yrds of the contrast colour light sample shown in miss la motte singles in colourway loam mc and remnants of a single ply yarn in green cc miss la motte singles - single ply 100% merino wool each 100g skein being approximately 360m 393yrds in length 2 size one size approximately 51cm 20 in circumference measured at the widest part of the hat the hat measures approximately 24cm 9 5 from the crown to cast on edge abbreviations k knit p - purl mc main colour cc contrast colour st st stocking stitch ssk slip slip knit k2tog knit two stitches together in the front of the stitch gauge 28 stitches and 36 row is 10cm 4in in stranded knitting knitted in the round and blocked knitting to gauge is important to ensure that your knitted item is the correct size and to ensure that yardage requirements are similar to those stated in the pattern instructions 1 using size 2 75mm needles cast on 144 stitches in mc using the cast on method of your choice join to knit in the round being careful not to twist your stitches place stitch marker if using to mark the beginning of your round 2 work in k2 p2 ribbing until pieces measures 10cm 4 from cast on edge 3 change to your 40cm 3 25mm needles and knit 4 rounds of st st 4 begin knitting the colourwork using the chart from page 3 the pattern is 12 stitches wide and is repeated 12 times you begin the chart from row 1 at the bottom right of the chart and read the chart from right to left it is recommended that you catch floats every 3 to 5 stitches 5 once you have completed the colourwork chart continue knitting in st st in mc until the work measures 22cm 8 5in measured from cast on edge 6 begin crown shaping as described below switching to the longer circular needle for magic loop or dpns when required crown shaping round 1 k14 k2tog to end round 2 and all subsequent even rounds
